meaningMnemonic: You fly <radical>north</radical> to the <radical>moon</radical> and break your <kanji>back</kanji> when you finally land on it. You weren’t braced for impact so when you hit the moon, your back took all of the impact.
readingMnemonic:
Your <kanji>back</kanji> hurts so much that the only way to properly explain the pain is in <reading>hai</reading>ku (はい) form. 

I flew to the moon.
It is there I broke my back.
My back hurts real bad.
